How many beats will be heard in one second? If 2 forks are sounded together then the number of beats heard will be equal to the difference of their frequencies. But I don't know how to calculate the beat frequency if 3 forks are sounded together. If you sound the 100 together with the 102, you will get a beat frequency of 2 beats/sec on a frequency of 101 Hz. When the 101 Hz is sounded there are no further beats added. So I would say, 2 beats. It is a little more complicated to analyse it by sounding the 100 and 101 first and then adding the 102. But if you pair 100 and 101, you get a 100.5 frequency and with 101 and 102 you get 101.5, each with one beat/sec. These two then beat down to 101 with another beat/sec.
